alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Clinton, northern Franklin and northeastern St. Lawrence Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brasher Falls, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moira, Bangor, Bombay, Malone, Churubusco, Ellenburg Depot, Bryants Mill, Chateaugay, Massena International Airport - Richards Field, Helena, Brasher Falls, Lyon Mountain, Burke, Merrill, Clayburg, Brushton, Lawrenceville, Dickinson, Ellenburg and Constable. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northern New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton
